ADDRESS_CONTRACTING_BODY.ADDRESS: Strategic Procurement Unit, PO Box 3, Shire Hall, Market Place

SHORT_DESCR.P: The framework is in 3 Lots;
Lot 1) Independent Psychological Assessments.
Lot 2) Independent Social Worker Assessments and
Lot 3) Parenting Assessments including PAMS.

Warwickshire County Council Children and Families Services may commission independent assessments on adults and children to inform their work or to support the court in a reaching a decision at the conclusion of family proceedings. Reports may be jointly commissioned during the legal process. Independent assessments may be commissioned under the direction of the court in respect of a specific case management issue or by Children and Family Services where an independent assessment is necessary or to manage capacity.

Providers are to produce assessment reports that address the specific questions, outcomes and requirements contained in the ISA / letter of instruction. The Provider will be requested to evidence that the service is being delivered against the outcomes.

MAIN_SITE.P: Within the county council boundaries of Warwickshire.
Also, within the boundaries of Solihull and Coventry if required.

SHORT_DESCR.P: WCC wish to put in place a multi-provider framework for expert assessments.
Lot 1 — Independent psychological assessments.

Psychological assessments are comprehensive assessments that include developmental, psychological and social issues of complex situations through the application of psychological formulation. An assessment will usually include but not be limited to;
— a combination of evidence based psychometric tests,
— in depth interviewing,
— observations.
— and a review of other professionals records such as social care, education, medical and forensic records.

Psychological assessments must be informed by the latest evidence in the field. This includes the use of the most up to date and relevant assessments and test based on accepted professional and academic opinion.

INFO_ADD.P: Warwickshire CC's current annual spend across all lots is GBP 390 679.
The initial contract term is 2 years, however, the council reserves the right to extend the contract by further periods not exceeding 24 months.
These services may be subject to modifications and changes in order to meet the changing needs of the council and the service and increases or decreases in funding.

MAIN_SITE.P: Within the county council boundaries of Warwickshire.
Also, within the boundaries of Solihull and coventry if required.

SHORT_DESCR.P: WCC wish to put in place a multi-provider framework for expert services — Independent psychological and independent social work assessments.
Lot 2 Independent social work assessments.

Independent social worker assessments are undertaken by accredited social workers who have a minimum of between 5 to 10 years post qualifying experience who practise as freelance experts. Assessments may be requested through the court process in cases where the local authority’s assessment is contested, an independent report is requested by parties or alternatively they may be requested to manage local authority capacity issues. Independent social worker assessments can include a range of areas including parenting capacity, risk assessments, contact and can be useful in providing a perspective on the overall functioning of the family unit.

INFO_ADD.P: Warwickshire CC's current annual spend across all lots is GBP 390 679.
The initial contract term is 2 years, however the Council reserves the right to extend the contract by further periods not exceeding 24 months.
These services may be subject to modifications and changes in order to meet the changing needs of the Council and the service and increases or decreases in funding.

MAIN_SITE.P: Within the county council boundaries of Warwickshire.
Also, within the boundaries of Solihull and coventry if required.

SHORT_DESCR.P: WCC wish to put in place a multi-provider framework for expert assessments.
Lot 3 Parenting assessments including PAMS.

Parenting capacity can be described as the ability to parent in a “good enough” manner long term. A parenting assessment assesses whether a parent has the capacity to look after their child/ren or has the motivation to change. The assessment should focus on identifying strengths and weaknesses and also take into account the impact of wider factors on parenting and the child's development. Parenting assessments may be undertaken using Parenting Assessment Manual Software (PAMS) for vulnerable parents and those with learning difficulties by Providers who have been trained and experienced in using the software.

INFO_ADD.P: Warwickshire CC's current annual spend is GBP 390 679.
The initial contract term is 2 years, however, the Council reserves the right to extend the contract by further periods not exceeding 24 months.
These services may be subject to modifications and changes in order to meet the changing needs of the Council and the service and increases or decreases in funding.

RULES_CRITERIA.P: All as detailed in the tender documentation.

The Council will undertake its financial assessment of the tendering organisation (and if considered necessary by the Council, any partners within a consortium bid) based on its own evaluation of the tenderers' most recent 2 years accounts (or if 2 years accounts are not available, equivalent evidence which confirms financial viability). The assessment of accounts will be supported by an independent credit reference report from Credit safe where this is available. The Council may also impose a bond or performance guarantee on the successful tenderer.
Minimum level(s) of standards possibly required: Evidence as stated in the tender documentation.

PERFORMANCE_CONDITIONS.P: As detailed in the tender documentation.

MAIN_FEATURES_AWARD.P: All as detailed in the tender documentation.

INFO_ADD.P: Warwickshire County Council will be using its e-tendering system (CSW-JETS) for the administration of this procurement process. Providers must register with the system to be able to express an interest and download documents. The web address for CSW-JETS is: www.csw-jets.co.uk Registration and use of CSW-JETS is free.

All correspondence or clarifications relating to this procurement must be via the CSWJETS correspondence function. If you are having trouble registering with CSW-JETS please email us at:procurement@warwickshire.gov.uk
Providers must register on CSW-JETS and express an interest in this project in order to download tender documents and be able to correspond with us about this procurement.
Electronic ordering and/or invoicing and/or payment may be used.
